2017 Gaming Resolutions

03 Jan 2017, 20:03
Meta

I’m constantly accumulating things that I want to do in gaming, but I almost never actually accomplish them. Sure, I get some things done, but usually it’s the low-hanging fruit, and I feel like I need a place to write them down, and actually make some progress on them.

So, here, in no particular order is the stuff I want to do in 2017:

Start a gaming blog

I’ve been planning on launching a gaming blog for a few years now, and I haven’t managed to actually get it off the ground. I’m hoping to get at least two major updates a week.

Publish a Gaming PDF

With the launch of the DM’s Guild and the similar storefronts for Cypher System and Unknown Armies, and the like, there’s a big opportunity for self-publishing some gaiming accessories. I’d like to get something out on OneBookShelf or one of their competitors in order to see if I can do it.

Run a few of my “backlog” games

Hello, my name is Adam, and I’m a Kickstarter Junkie. In the last few years, I’ve kickstarted at least a dozen new RPGs that I have yet to even run a single game of:

  • Monsterhearts 2
  • Bluebeard’s Bride
  • Fate Core
  • The Strange
  • Iron Edda: The War of Metal & Bone
  • Amazing Adventures
  • Victorious
  • Shadow of the Demon Lord
  • No Thank you Evil
  • Dungeon Crawl Classics
  • Seventh Sea 2nd Edition
  • Apocalypse World 2nd Edition
  • Unknown Armies 3rd Edition
  • M.A.S.H.E.D.
  • Swords and Wizardry
  • Pitfalls and Penguins

That’s a lot of games, and I haven’t played any of them. I’ve read most of them, and pulled ideas from them into the other games I’m running, but I haven’t run or played in any of them as written. That sucks. I really want to start chipping away at the list of un-played games this year.
